business.headline: Tata Group stock falls 4% as Jhunjhunwala eyes exit from multibaggerThe Jhunjhunwala family first invested in Tata Motors in the September 2020 quarter, when Rakesh Jhunjhunwala picked up 4 crore shares of the company

Explained: Why SpiceJet shares jumped 9% todaySpiceJet recently raised Rs 3,000 crore through a qualified institutional placement (QIP). The airline is also set to receive an additional Rs 736 crore from a previous funding round, which will help support its growth plans.

Cognizant favoured H-1B holders over non-Indian workers, says US juryThis case dates back to 2017 when a class-action lawsuit was filed against the IT giant, accusing it of bias in its employment practices.
Crude oil prices seem to stabilise as all-out war fears recedeTensions between Israel and Iran led to a 13 per cent spurt in Brent crude prices in the past seven days.

Stock market reacts to China stimulus: Is there further dip in Sensex, Nifty?Despite some analysts hoping that foreign portfolio investment (FPI) outflows from India might reverse, further declines in Indian stocks cannot be dismissed, as per experts.
Ola Electric shares fall 6% after show cause notice; drops 46% from peakOla Electric has been given 15 days to respond to the notice and will provide the required documents within that time frame.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as global uncertainty fuels cautious sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 321.03 points to 81,371.03, while the Nifty50 added 73.45 points to 24,869.20.

Central panel's notice to Ola after surge in complaints against EVs: SourcesThe Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has taken cognisance of thousands of complaints and issued a show-cause notice to Ola Electric, sources said.

RBI MPC: Is rate cut on card? Shaktikanta Das to announce soonSpeculation has grown about the possibility of a rate cut or a shift in monetary policy, especially after the US Federal Reserve delivered an unexpected 50-basis-point cut in September 2024.

Zepto shifting its base to Total Mall in Sarjapur, Bengaluru: ReportZepto had earlier asked its 1,700-1,800 employees to move from its current base in Powai, Mumbai, to Bengaluru. However, the timeline was pushed back due to delays in finalising an appropriate location.
Sensex, Nifty close in red despite IT boost; global factors weigh heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 638.45 points to end at 81,050, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 218.85 points to close at 24,795.75.

Explained: Why NBCC India shares are falling 30% on mobile trading appsThe company has performed well in recent times, with its shares increasing by 109% in 2024 and a massive 192% over the last year.

Mark Zuckerberg flaunts 'his and her' Porsches, designs minivan for wifeZuckerberg posted photos and videos of a Porsche 911 GT3 with a touring package for himself, and a customised Porsche Cayenne Turbo GT Minivan for Priscilla.
RVNL, IRFC, IRCON: Railway stocks fall up to 8%. Check hereRailway stocks such as RVNL, IRFC, IRCON saw a decline on the stock exchanges on Monday.

Gold, silver price today, October 7, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today October 7, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Ola Electric shares tank 8% in early trade day after CEO's ugly spat with comicOla Electric shares have dropped 43% from its all-time high, and has seen a decline in five of the last six trading sessions.

Fashion venture on cards: Is Mark Zuckerberg shifting from tech to trendy? Known for his casual wardrobe, which usually includes plain grey t-shirts and hoodies, Zuckerberg is now adding a personal touch to his outfits.

India's FII assets surpass $1 trillion, equity holdings at 6-month peakFor the first time, the total assets under custody of FIIs across various investment vehicles, including debt, equity, alternative investment funds (AIF), mutual funds, and hybrid funds, surpassed $1 trillion.
Sensex, Nifty rebound after last week's slump led by rally in IT stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 239.85 points to 81,928.30, while the NSE Nifty50 added 60.40 points to 25,075.00.

Succession Wars: Sibling rivalry that led to the birth of Adidas and PumaAdolf 'Adi' Dassler and Rudolf Dassler, transformed the world of sports footwear through innovation, ambition, and intense sibling rivalry.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Over 45 senior doctors resign from RG Kar in support of juniors' protestOver 45 senior doctors of RG Kar Medical College and Hospital have resigned, expressing solidarity with their junior colleagues who are protesting against the rape and murder of a trainee doctor in August this year.

CM for just 200 days, Saini is Nayab for BJP in HaryanaNayab Singh Saini was brought in as Haryana Chief Minister around 200 days ahead of the Assembly election in the state. Saini, with his schemes won people's confidence, and helped the BJP create history in Haryana, beating 10 years of anti-incumbency.

Vinesh Phogat wins Haryana's Julana in debut election, defeats BJP's Yogesh KumarWrestler Vinesh Phogat won the Julana seat in the Haryana Assembly election, defeating BJP's Yogesh Kumar by over 6,015 votes in her debut election.

Physics Nobel to John Hopfield and Godfather of AI Geoffrey HintonThe Nobel Prize in Physics is a yearly award given by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences to those who have made the most outstanding contributions to humankind in the field of physics.

How's the josh: Omar Abdullah's sister to NC workers as party set for victoryAccording to the Election Commission, the National Conference won 36 seats and was ahead on six, while the Congress won six seats.

Live: BJP set for 3rd term in Haryana, NC-Congress maintain huge lead in J&KAssembly Election Results 2024 Live: Counting of votes for the high-stakes Assembly elections in Jammu and Kashmir and Haryana is currently underway. Early leads show the BJP crossing the halfway mark in Haryana, while the National Conference-Congress alliance has maintained a lead in Jammu and Kashmir. While Jammu and Kashmir voted in three phases from September 18 to October 1, Haryana went to the polls in a single phase on October 5. This was the first time that the union territory voted in an Assembly election in the past 10 years and also the first after abrogation of Article 370. In Haryana, these polls are the first major direct contest between the BJP and the Congress following the Lok Sabha polls. A total of 873 candidates are in the running in Jammu and Kashmir, while Haryana will decide the fate of 1,031 candidates.  Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.
Is NC-Congress's big J&K show referendum on Article 370? What BJP saidBJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya said that the NC-Congress performance in J&K is not a referendum on Article 370.

Assembly polls: 'Doda barfi' for AAP in Jammu and Kashmir, zilch in HaryanaAssembly poll results: The AAP, which is in power in Punjab and Delhi, now has members in the legislative assemblies of Jammu and Kashmir, Goa, and Gujarat.

The Tribe on Prime: If 'any resemblance to real is purely coincidental' had a face! The Tribe, available on Prime Video, is like the best of this glossy, entitled world which is not yours. It is based on the lives and 'struggles' of five young women who are established content creators in their own rights, and are now using their 'talents' to build an even greater audience. All in Los Angeles.

BJP faces setback in 2 key Hindu-majority seats in Jammu region: Bani and RambanThe BJP lost to an Independent candidate from Bani Assembly seat in Jammu and Kashmir by 18,672 votes, while the party lost to the National Conference in Ramban by a margin of 8,869 votes.

S Jaishankar's remarks self-explanatory: Pak on bilateral talks with IndiaS Jaishankar, who will lead a delegation to Islamabad next week, had also toed a similar line and maintained that his visit was meant for a multilateral event.
Why Ahirwal belt is key for BJP in Haryana election matrixHaryana poll results: The Ahirwal region, spanning Gurgaon, Rewari and Mahendergarh, has largely remained loyal to the BJP since 2014.

Mithun Chakraborty reflects on Dadasaheb Phalke honour: Recognition is importantActor Mithun Chakraborty, the Dadasaheb Phalke Award recipient, reflects on his journey, the importance of awards, his evolving approach to films, and his desire for re-releases of past hits.

Maldives President visits Taj Mahal, says words can't do justice to its beautyMaldives President Mohamed Muizzu and First Lady Sajidha Mohamed visited the iconic Taj Mahal in Agra. Muizzu said it was tough to describe the monument's beauty as "words simply cannot do it justice".

Haryana election: BJP ahead of Congress but trails in vote shareThe BJP was leading in 49 seats in Haryana compared to Congress's 35, but Congress holds a higher vote share of 40.25% against the BJP's 39.29% at 12.30 pm, according to the Election Commission.

Accept what people want: Robert Vadra as BJP set for Haryana hat-trickHaryana election result 2024: The Congress has so far won 13 seats and is leading in 21, while the BJP has a lead in 43 of the 90 Assembly constituencies in Haryana.

PDP's Iltija Mufti concedes defeat: I accept people's verdictIltija Mufti, PDP candidate and daughter of former J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti, conceded defeat in the Srigufwara-Bijbehara constituency, accepting the people's verdict and expressing gratitude to her party workers.

National Film Awards Ceremony 2024 Live: President Droupadi Murmu to present awards soon70th National Awards Ceremony 2024 Live Update: The prestigious National Film Awards ceremony is currently underway in New Delhi, honouring artists for their exceptional work in Indian cinema.

Commander of Hezbollah headquarters killed in Beirut strikes: Israeli militaryIn a social media post, the IDF claimed that Hezbollah's logistics unit head Suhail Hussein Husseini was killed following a strike on a compound in Beirut. There was no immediate comment from Hezbollah.

Pakistanis troll state guest Zakir Naik who wanted extra baggage fee waivedZakir Naik has been living in Malaysia since 2016 after the National Investigation Agency registered a case against him in the wake of the Dhaka terror attack, where one of the attackers admitted that he was influenced by the controversial preacher's speeches. India has requested his extradition, but Malaysia has not complied so far.

Why chasing the Yummy Mummy ideal image is just toxicAlong with caring for their babies, new moms should focus on their own health. But this doesn't mean they have to obsess over fitness to fit the 'yummy mummy' image seen on social media.

I thought it was a scam call until I didn't: Journalist's digital arrest ordealA journalist received a call from a courier company claiming her Aadhaar number was linked to a parcel containing drugs. What followed was an hours-long ordeal that made the journalist feel as though she was being held digitally hostage by scammers.
After Mira Murati, another OpenAI executive leaves company  Tim Brooks, a pivotal figure at OpenAI, is departing to join Google DeepMind, marking another high-profile exit from the company.

Chitra Sarwara gives tough fight to BJP's Anil Vij in Ambala, leads by 617 votesIndependent candidate Chitra Sarwara is contesting against senior BJP leader Anil Vij and Congress's Parvinder Pal Pari in the 2024 Haryana Assembly polls.

KJo dedicates Brahmastra National Award to Ayan Mukerji: I am here to just clapBrahmastra producer Karan Johar was present at the 70th National Film Awards ceremony in Delhi with Ayan Mukerji. The film bagged honours in three major categories.

sports.headline: Naveen-Ashu aim to guide Dabang Delhi to Pro Kabaddi League title once againUnder a new coach in the form of Joginder Narwal and equipped with star raider duo Naveen Kumar and Ashu Malik, Dabang Delhi will be aiming to reclaim the Pro Kabaddi League title in season 11.

Will Nitish Rana be retained by KKR? Player yet to receive call from franchiseKKR batter Nitish Rana has hoped that he can extend his stay at Kolkata Knight Riders. Rana, who has been at KKR for 7 years has revealed that he has received no communication if he will be retained or let go from the franchise.

Bowling consultant James Anderson joins England in Multan after golf criticismPakistan vs England, 1st Test: Bowling consultant James Anderson joined the England team in Multan on Day 2 of the series opener. Anderson's absence was questioned after he was spotted playing golf in Scotland earlier in the month.

Mayank Yadav for Border Gavaskar Trophy? Basit Ali's wish after pacer's debutFormer Pakistan batter Basit Ali has claimed that he wants to see Mayank Yadav in the India squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy in Australia. Mayank made his India debut in fine fashion.

Former England and Sri Lanka coach Silverwood joins Sharjah WarriorzSharjah Warriorz appointed Chris Silverwood as their new bowling coach for ILT20. The former England and Sri Lanka head coach will team up with JP Duminy to bolster the coaching setup ahead of the upcoming season.

Confidence, trust, bit of luck: Sanath Jayasuriya's recipe for Sri Lanka revivalSanath Jayasuriya has said that confidence, trust and a bit of luck has been the reasons behind his success as the coach of the Sri Lankan team. Jayasuriya was given the permanent job on October 7, Monday.

India ki shaan Suryakumar: Hosts get traditional punjabi welcome in DelhiThe Indian team got a traditional punjabi welcome as they arrived in Delhi ahead of the second T20I against Bangladesh on Monday, October 7. India will aim to clinch the series with a win at the Arun Jaitley stadium on Wednesday.

Don't use Travis Head as opener in Tests against India: Ian ChappellFormer Australia cricketer Ian Chappell has warned the team against using Travis Head as an opener against India. Australia are facing a crisis at the openers' spot since the retirement of David Warner.

Como offer Napoli fans free beer to reward warm reception at MaradonaComo has announced that they will be offering Napoli fans free beer in February when they welcome Antonio Conte's side for the return match. The Como team and fans got a warm reception at the Maradona recently.

IRE vs SA: Paul Stirling guides Ireland to consolation win in final ODIIRE vs SA: Ireland bagged a consolation win in the final ODI of the series with a 69-run victory. Ireland captain Paul Stirling starred on the day, hitting 88 off 92 balls.

Women's T20 World Cup, AUS vs NZ Live streaming: When and where to watch liveNew Zealand and Australia will face each other in a trans-Tasman rivalry at the Women's T20 World Cup 2024. Find out all the live streaming details of the exciting contest here.

Sarfaraz Khan celebrates Irani Trophy win with father, injured brotherInda and Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan celebrated the Irani Trophy win with his father and injured brother. Sarfaraz's brother Musheer was ruled out of the Irani Trophy due to a road accident.

Rodri, Carvajal, De Bruyne: Injury haunts players against new scheduleDani Carvajal's ACL tear highlights mounting player concerns over the congested football calendar, as elite athletes like Kevin De Bruyne and Rodri suffer significant injuries in the wake of gruelling schedules imposed by expanded club competitions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
